dt: {bc}to have a desire for (something, such as something unattainable)

dt.t: {wi}wished{/wi} he could live his life over

dt: {bc}to give expression to as a wish {bc}{sx|bid||}
{bc}to request in the form of a wish {bc}{sx|order||}
{bc}to desire (a person or thing) to be as specified

pt: {sc}desire{/sc} {sc}wish{/sc} {sc}want{/sc} {sc}crave{/sc} {sc}covet{/sc} mean to have a longing for. {sc}desire{/sc} stresses the strength of feeling and often implies strong intention or aim.
{sc}wish{/sc} sometimes implies a general or transient longing especially for the unattainable.
{sc}want{/sc} specifically suggests a felt need or lack.
{sc}crave{/sc} stresses the force of physical appetite or emotional need.

et: Middle English {it}wisshen{/it}, from Old English {it}wȳscan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}wunsken{/it} to wish, Sanskrit {it}vāñchati{/it} he wishes, {it}vanoti{/it} he strives for {ma}{mat|win|}{/ma}
shortdef: to have a desire for (something, such as something unattainable)
to give expression to as a wish : bid

dt: {bc}an act or instance of {a_link|wishing} or desire {bc}{sx|want||}
{bc}a request or command couched as a wish
{bc}an invocation of good or evil fortune on someone

shortdef: an act or instance of wishing or desire : want
an expressed will or desire : mandate

dt: {bc}despite the fact that one does not want someone to (do something)

dt.t: His parents were angry when they learned he had borrowed the car {it}against their wishes{/it}.

shortdef: despite the fact that one does not want someone to (do something)

dt: {bc}even though someone does not want it

dt.t: They canceled the trip {it}against my wishes{/it}.

shortdef: even though someone does not want it

dt: {bc}to do whatever one wants to do

shortdef: to do whatever one wants to do

dt: {bc}to do whatever someone else wants one to do

shortdef: to do whatever someone else wants one to do

dt: {bc}to do something even though someone does not want one to do it

dt.t: They {it}went against their parents' wishes{/it} and got married.

shortdef: to do something even though someone does not want one to do it

dt: {bc}the conscious or unconscious desire for the death of oneself or of another

shortdef: the conscious or unconscious desire for the death of oneself or of another

dt: {bc}to cause (something) to stop or go away just by wanting it to stop or go away

shortdef: to cause (something) to stop or go away just by wanting it to stop or go away
